thread.title: Coronation Street stars celebrate day off as Storm Doris causes soaps filming to be cancelled
thread.title_full: Coronation Street stars celebrate day off as Storm Doris causes soaps filming to be cancelled

title: Coronation Street stars celebrate day off as Storm Doris causes soaps filming to be cancelled
text:
Coronation Street stars celebrate day off as Storm Doris causes soaps filming to be cancelled 
Doris has caused chaos on the cobbles with her vicious winds and rain Revealed Comments CORONATION Street stars have taken full advantage of their day off thanks to Storm Doris. 
The ITV soap was plunged into crisis earlier today by the storm that has wreaked havoc up and down the nation but with it causing Corrie’s filming to be cancelled, the stars have been celebrating. 
— David Kester (@davidkester67) February 23, 2017 #stormdoris putting a stop to cobble filming @itvcorrie this morning 😬🌪Back home for snugs, sofa n a film with my monkeys 🐒🐒😍👍🏼 
— Samia Longchambon (@realsamia) February 23, 2017 #stormdorris batten down the hatches and drink plenty of tea! 🌬🌬🌬 
— Dolly-Rose Campbell (@dolly_campbell) February 23, 2017 
Samia Longchambon, who plays Maria Connor in the show, revealed: “#StormDoris putting a stop to cobble filming @itvcorrie this morning. Back home for snugs, sofa n a film with my monkeys.” 
Actress Dolly-Rose Campbell added: “#Stormdoris batten down the hatches and drink plenty of tea!” 
Belying her gentle name, Doris has torn through the UK and caused chaos for Corrie’s crew and cast as her wind and rain stopped them from filming a major storyline with Rosie and Sophie Webster. 
Actresses Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent were pictured wrapping up from the severe storm as the wind caused the crew to have to run around to hold props down. 
Umbrellas, pallets and mattresses flew around the set preventing the Corrie lot from filming despite doing their best. Mark Campbell/MCPIX Coronation Street crisis as Storm Doris stops soap from filming major Rosie Webster storyline Eamonn and James Clarke Belying her gentle name, Doris has torn through the UK and caused chaos for Corrie’s crew and cast as her wind and rain stopped them from filming 

It comes after the soap confirmed Helen would be sticking around – presuming Doris doesn’t blow her away – on the cobbles for a long time yet. 
The actress, who plays Rosie Webster in the ITV soap, initially rejoined the show after five years away on a three-month contract but soap bosses have extended her stint until at least December. Mark Campbell/MCPIX Helen was forced to take cover as she fled Doris’ wrath Mark Campbell/MCPIX Brooke took cover until a giant umbrella with a crew member Mark Campbell/MCPIX 16 Helen was sheltered under another giant umbrella as filming was halted 
Show boss Kate Oates said: “We are thrilled to have Helen back and delighted that she is now going to become a more permanent fixture in Weatherfield. 
“Rosie is a classic Coronation Street comedy character and we are looking forward to seeing more of her antics in the future.” 
Helen added: “I am having so much fun being back here playing Rosie again. The writing is hilarious and I am delighted to be staying around. 
“I can’t wait to see what Rosie is going to get up to.” Mark Campbell/MCPIX The crew surrounded the actresses as they valiantly tried to continue filming in the face of Doris Mark Campbell/MCPIX 16 The cold weather might have stopped filming temporarily but it won’t stop the northerners 
It comes as the actress hit back at haters who trolled her over her Coronation Street acting skills. 
Helen’s re-appearance on the show caused online trolls to viciously attack her acting skills . 
Now the former I’m A Celebrity star, who has played Rosie since she was ten, has taken to Instagram to take the high road and tell the trolls exactly what she thinks. 
She posted a graphic with the words: “No matter how rich, cool, educated, or talented you believe you are, how you treat people ultimately tells all. 
“Integrity is everything.” 
Her post was quickly liked by former Coronation Street star Michelle Keegan while her on-screen sister, actress Brooke Vincent , commented: “[love] my girl.” ❤ A post shared by Helen Flanagan (@hjgflanagan) on Feb 9, 2017 at 3:06am PST 
— Brooke Levi Vincent (@BrookeLVincent) February 9, 2017 
Brooke also took to Twitter to defend her friend, posting a picture of the words: “Don’t let anyone EVER dull your sparkle,” alongside an emoji for two women, a peace sign and a love heart. 
Helen had been trolled by cruel haters online after returning to the soap as Rosie Webster. 
She returned to the cobbles with an almighty bang – and has brought trouble in her wake as police searched her dad Kevin’s house. 
Tonight saw the much-anticipated comeback of Helen Flanagan, who certainly didn’t make a meek comeback as feisty Rosie. First glimpse of Helen Flanagan on her return to Coronation Street as Rosie 16 Rosie Webster made her triumphant return this week 
Having returned from the US with her sister Sophie, the pair found themselves on the wrong side of the law as they were taken into custody. 
The police had ransacked their house and found a bag of suspicious-looking powder in Rosie's luggage, which she claimed was "sweetener for her tea". 
Rosie and Sophie were let go after being interrogated. 
Their family were left gobsmacked by the police invasion, but later when Rosie received the make-up bag she'd left in the taxi Sophie became suspicious.
